title: HR Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at CHRISTUS Spohn Health System (Corpus Christi, TX) in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: Signed all of my paperwork and then told me that the department was overstaffed. This was a huge setback for me as I’d stopped looking for employment elsewhere when they signed my internship agreement
Interview Questions: Availability dates; interests; skills; experience

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at CHRISTUS Spohn Health System (Corpus Christi, TX) in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions: I emailed the point of contact I was given for my senior capstone class, and received a reply within about a week's time. I was told that before a decision was made, an online interview was typically conducted to be sure that the student would be a good fit for placement. We scheduled an interview over Zoom that lasted for a little over an hour. After that, I was told that I would be contacted by the end of that week and that they would let me know whether I would be accepted or not. I was then contacted and accepted via email and asked to provide availability for in-person/on-site hours, and was also asked to come in to full discuss a schedule and fill out paperwork.
Interview Questions: Tell me something about yourself. How did you hear about this position? What are your strengths and weaknesses? What do you know about this company/organization? Do you have any questions for me? Where do you see yourself in 6 years? What areas or departments are you interested in?

title: Registered Nurse Interview

title: HR-Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at CHRISTUS Spohn Health System in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: I was called in for an interview after the application I made online. I walked into their office and started waiting for my appointment. Every single person that noticed me waiting did not hesitate to say "Hi" and most of them even ask me if I need anything in the mean time. I must say it is a very friendly environment. I met with three recruiters in a meeting room for the interview. All of them were so friendly and made me comfortable with the interview before we went into questioning. They used a cross-questioning method and all three employers asked questions without an order. They explained company culture and what they expect from me in a very friendly and professional manner. One of the best interviews that I have had in my career despite the fact that I was not offered for the job.
Interview Questions: How can you benefit our organization?

title: Healthcare Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at CHRISTUS Spohn Health System (Corpus Christi, TX) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions:
The interview process was a full eight hour day consisting of multiple interviews. At 8am we started with a group interview with all the ancillary managers. The nursing departments interviewed me next. Then I had a one-on-one with the Administrator and a lunch interview with the Medical Director. The department staff interviewed me in two separate groups. I don't believe there was a difference between the two groups other than they were available at different times. I ended the day with an HR interview. 

There were tons of behavioral based questions, technical questions by the staff, and the Administrator put me through a bunch of real-life scenarios. He was really straight-forward, and blunt which was a different style than the rest of the interviews. Be prepared to explain in detail why you want to work there and he'll try to put you on the defensive. If you say your challenge is keeping up your staff's morale, he's likely to ask why he should  hire you if you haven't figured out how to keep up morale? It was interesting, challenging and fun in a weird way.
Interview Questions: I have people that can balance productivity and morale. If you're challenged by that, why should I hire you?
